pros: Flexible, Engaging, Experience, Teamwork, Leadership
cons: Late nights, Weird Hours, Different Pay

pros: Small institution with diverse student population (as in different types of students, not ethnically diverse), some longterm people who are committed to student success. Fabulous students who are curious and ready to be challenged. As a new professional or someone who wants to add to their portfolio, DSU is a good stepping stone. Even though the town is small, GREAT people and a wonderful place for those with younger children.
cons: The institution itself is conservative and closed to those who are more diverse, good old boys/girls network is alive and thriving, high turnover of gifted, creative faculty and staff. If you are someone who can break into the core group (so you should be white and mainstream), there are unlimited career advancement opportunities (even without a Master's or Doctorate).

pros: Great place to get experience or great place to retire.  If you are self-motivated you can accomplish quite a bit. University is growing.
cons: Benefits: low to no raises, no sabbaticals, no dependent tuition support, town is quite small (little in the way of choice/options)

job_title: Health Informatics Research Analyst in Madison, SD
pros: The school provides good facilities for the employer. Also, the school is technically sound. Higher level management are good. Last, but not the leas, living cost is low.
cons: The town is small. And, anybody who is used to live in big city may find it difficult. Again, the weather in winter is very harsh. Anybody who absolutely hate cold weather may not like it.

review_title: Relationship building to pave way for fundraisers.
pros: opportunity to build relationships with numbers of people, helping students achieve educational goals, opportunity for creativity
cons: state job so salaries are set, not much incentive to work harder than expected since no monetary rewards

job_title: IT Help Desk Technician in Madison, SD
pros: The college offer opportunity for the student to work in the IT department which give the student a solid foundation to steeping into the IT field.
cons: Its doesn't pay much, but as a student its still a fair pay for a start.
